Veteran: Sure, uh, the main metric for us was range of communication and um- for voice networks, anyways, it was range. For digital networks it was speed, uh, so we deployed to Kandahar, there was one FOB and two small combat outposts there when we got there.

Veteran: Uh, they were all radio to voice, um, satellite communications, and some HF stuff. Uh, so we came in for the- for the VHF stuff, we just added um, there was a mountain to our south at the very southern border of our AO.

Veteran: So we put a retran station on the mountaintop, and that expanded the range that we could do, you know, patrol communications at. Uh, so the biggest concern for us was having, a fires net that uh you know, we could call for mortars, artillery, um, air support when we got it, which was mostly helicopters- talking to helicopters didn't really um, you know we didn't really have any restrictions there, helicopter's up in- pretty high up above the ground.
